newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech PX50 falls at fixing led by CEZ.
newsitem.headline: Czech PX50 falls at fixing led by CEZ.

text.p: Czech power utility CEZ posted sharply lower first half net profits on Friday pulling the PX50 index down slightly at the fixing.
CEZ dropped 13 crowns, 1.4 percent, to 905 after announcing first half 1997 net profits of 3.53 billion crowns compared with 5.95 billion in the same period last year.
"The figures look really bad ...again it shows that this company is going nowhere," said Eugene Klerk, an analyst at ABNM AMRO Hoare Govett.
Elsewhere, SPT Telecom dropped 13 crowns to 3,807.
SPT is one of the very few major Czech companies which this week posted positive first half results. All of the top banks listed on the PX50, saw profits fall sharply.
On Friday, Komercni clawed back seven crowns to 1,628 after falling sharply in the previous session. IPB dropped another seven crowns to 227 while Ceska Sporitelna was up one crown to 264.
